alert.note: Alert for Fountain; Parke; Vermillion; Warren (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 28 at 11:56AM EDT until March 29 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Illinois... White River from Edwardsport to Hazleton. Wabash River from Covington to Mount Carmel. .Lowland flooding continues on portions of the Wabash and White rivers as a result of multiple rounds of rainfall in recent weeks. Flooding on the lower Wabash River is expected to last as long as another 4 days, while flooding on the White River is expected to come to an end late Thursday evening. The crest on the Wabash is near Terre Haute, while the crest on the White is between Edwardsport and Petersburg. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Covington. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.5 feet, Some low agricultural fields flood. Backyard flood of cottages a short distance north of U.S. Highway 136. High water blocks land access to at least one residence. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM EDT Monday the stage was 17.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:45 AM EDT Monday was 19.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 7.9 feet Thursday, April 07. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated by 11 PM EDT.
